Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES SEARCH - ITERATION 2 ===\n') print('Objective: Fix parsing errors and analyze saved HTML files for book identification') print('Previous issues: Google Scholar 403 blocks, text_lower variable error in parsing\n') # First, inspect the saved search results file to understand its structure results_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practices_search.json' if os.path.exists(results_file): print('üìã INSPECTING PREVIOUS SEARCH RESULTS FILE:') print(f'File: {results_file}') with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f'Keys in results file: {list(previous_results.keys())}') print(f'Search methods attempted: {len(previous_results.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Previous findings count: {len(previous_results.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Analysis summary: {previous_results.get("analysis_summary", {})}') print() else: print('‚ùå Previous results file not found, starting fresh') previous_results = {} # List and analyze all saved HTML files print('üîç ANALYZING SAVED HTML FILES FOR MANUAL EXTRACTION:') print('=' * 60) html_files = [] for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): html_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() # Initialize comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Manual analysis of saved HTML files for violin performance practices book', 'files_analyzed': [], 'extracted_findings': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'relevant_content': [] } # Analyze each HTML file systematically for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f'=== ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ===') file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_info = { 'filename': filename, 'file_size': os.path.getsize(file_path), 'source_type': 'unknown', 'findings_count': 0, 'relevant_snippets': [] } # Determine source type from filename if 'scholar' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Google Scholar' elif 'books' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Google Books' elif 'academic' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Academic Database' try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Source: {file_info["source_type"]}') print(f'File size: {file_info["file_size"]:,} bytes') # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner text analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Extract all text content full_text = soup.get_text() # Define comprehensive search terms for violin performance practices search_terms = { 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument', 'fiddle'], 'technique_terms': ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique', 'fingering'], 'historical_terms': ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', '1800s', 'historical', 'period'], 'academic_terms': ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'research', 'analysis'], 'school_terms': ['German school', 'national school', 'pedagogy', 'method'], 'specific_terms': ['bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'repertoire influence'] } # Count term occurrences text_lower = full_text.lower() term_matches = {} total_relevance_score = 0 for category, terms in search_terms.items(): category_matches = [] for term in terms: if term in text_lower: count = text_lower.count(term) category_matches.append({'term': term, 'count': count}) total_relevance_score += count term_matches[category] = category_matches print(f'Total relevance score: {total_relevance_score}') # Extract specific content sections that might contain book information relevant_sections = [] # Look for book titles and academic references # Try multiple selectors for different sites potential_selectors = [ 'h3', # Common for search result titles '.gs_rt', # Google Scholar result titles '.BNeawe', # Google search result titles 'a[href*="books.google"]', # Google Books links '.result-title', # Generic result titles 'cite', # Citation elements '.citation' # Citation classes ] for selector in potential_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) for element in elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 20: # Filter out very short text element_lower = element_text.lower() # Check if this element contains relevant terms relevance_count = 0 matched_terms = [] for category, terms in search_terms.items(): for term in terms: if term in element_lower: relevance_count += 1 matched_terms.append(term) if relevance_count >= 2: # At least 2 relevant terms relevant_sections.append({ 'text': element_text[:200], # First 200 chars 'selector': selector, 'relevance_count': relevance_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms[:10] # Limit to 10 terms }) file_info['findings_count'] = len(relevant_sections) file_info['relevance_score'] = total_relevance_score file_info['term_matches'] = term_matches file_info['relevant_snippets'] = relevant_sections[:5] # Top 5 snippets print(f'Relevant sections found: {len(relevant_sections)}') print(f'Term matches by category:') for category, matches in term_matches.items(): if matches: print(f' {category}: {[f"{m["term"]}({m["count"]})" for m in matches[:3]]}') # Display top relevant sections if relevant_sections: print('\nTop relevant content:') for j, section in enumerate(relevant_sections[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Relevance: {section["relevance_count"]} | Terms: {section["matched_terms"][:5]}') print(f' {section["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for section in relevant_sections: analysis_results['extracted_findings'].append({ 'source_file': filename, 'source_type': file_info['source_type'], 'content': section['text'], 'relevance_count': section['relevance_count'], 'matched_terms': section['matched_terms'], 'selector': section['selector'] }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') file_info['error'] = str(e) analysis_results['files_analyzed'].append(file_info) print(f'Completed analysis of {filename}\n') # Comprehensive analysis of all findings print('=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF EXTRACTED CONTENT') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(analysis_results['extracted_findings']) print(f'Total content sections extracted: {total_findings}') print(f'Files successfully analyzed: {len([f for f in analysis_results["files_analyzed"] if "error" not in f])}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 50) # Identify high-potential book candidates book_indicators = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'monograph', 'publication', 'volume'] violin_indicators = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string'] technique_indicators = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'technique', 'performance'] historical_indicators = ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', 'historical'] for finding in analysis_results['extracted_findings']: content_lower = finding['content'].lower() has_book = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in book_indicators) has_violin = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in violin_indicators) has_technique = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in technique_indicators) has_historical = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in historical_indicators) # Calculate book candidate score candidate_score = 0 if has_book: candidate_score += 3 if has_violin: candidate_score += 2 if has_technique: candidate_score += 2 if has_historical: candidate_score += 2 candidate_score += finding['relevance_count'] # Add general relevance if candidate_score >= 6: # High threshold for book candidates book_candidate = { 'content': finding['content'], 'source_file': finding['source_file'], 'source_type': finding['source_type'], 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'has_book': has_book, 'has_violin': has_violin, 'has_technique': has_technique, 'has_historical': has_historical, 'matched_terms': finding['matched_terms'] } analysis_results['book_candidates'].append(book_candidate) print(f'High-potential book candidates identified: {len(analysis_results["book_candidates"])}') # Display book candidates for i, candidate in enumerate(analysis_results['book_candidates'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. CANDIDATE SCORE: {candidate["candidate_score"]}') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_type"]} ({candidate["source_file"]})') print(f' Indicators: Book={candidate["has_book"]}, Violin={candidate["has_violin"]}, Technique={candidate["has_technique"]}, Historical={candidate["has_historical"]}') print(f' Matched terms: {candidate["matched_terms"][:8]}') print(f' Content: {candidate["content"]}...') # Analyze findings by source type print('\nüìä FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 40) by_source = {} for finding in analysis_results['extracted_findings']: source = finding['source_type'] if source not in by_source: by_source[source] = [] by_source[source].append(finding) for source, findings in by_source.items(): avg_relevance = sum(f['relevance_count'] for f in findings) / len(findings) if findings else 0 print(f' {source}: {len(findings)} findings (avg relevance: {avg_relevance:.1f})') # Show top finding from each source if findings: top_finding = max(findings, key=lambda x: x['relevance_count']) print(f' Top: {top_finding["content"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {top_finding["matched_terms"][:5]}') print() else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content extracted from HTML files') print('This suggests:') print('1. Search results may not contain the target book information') print('2. Content may be dynamically loaded (JavaScript)') print('3. Need alternative search strategies') # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_book_analysis_results.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: {analysis_file}') # Create summary report summary_report = { 'search_objective': 'Book on 19th-century violin performance practices arguing vibrato influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'specific_focus': 'German school vs performer with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'files_processed': len(html_files), 'total_findings': total_findings, 'book_candidates': len(analysis_results['book_candidates']), 'success_rate': f'{(total_findings/len(html_files)*100):.1f}%' if html_files else '0%', 'top_sources': list(by_source.keys()) if total_findings > 0 else [], 'recommendations': [] } if analysis_results['book_candidates']: summary_report['recommendations'] = [ 'Follow up on high-scoring book candidates', 'Search for full-text access to identified publications', 'Look up specific authors mentioned in candidates', 'Check university music libraries for physical copies' ] summary_report['status'] = 'Potential candidates identified' else: summary_report['recommendations'] = [ 'Try alternative search engines (Bing, DuckDuckGo)', 'Search music-specific databases (RILM, JSTOR Music)', 'Look for violin pedagogy and historical performance keywords', 'Search for specific violin schools and techniques', 'Check conservatory and music school publications' ] summary_report['status'] = 'No clear candidates - need alternative approach' summary_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_search_summary.json') with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüìã SUMMARY REPORT SAVED TO: {summary_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä PROCESSING STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files analyzed: {len(html_files)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Content sections extracted: {total_findings}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High-potential book candidates: {len(analysis_results["book_candidates"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Success rate: {summary_report["success_rate"]}') print(f'\nüéØ STATUS: {summary_report["status"]}') print(f'\nüìã NEXT STEPS:') for i, rec in enumerate(summary_report['recommendations'], 1): print(f' {i}. {rec}') if analysis_results['book_candidates']: print('\n‚úÖ PROMISING LEADS IDENTIFIED - Ready for follow-up research') else: print('\nüîÑ NEED ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY - Current approach yielded limited results') print('\n=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed due to variable scoping error - Code ran successfully through the HTML file analysis phase and extracted relevant content from saved search files, but crashed with 'NameError: name 'content_lower' is not defined' during the book candidate identification section. The script successfully analyzed 10 HTML files (totaling 22 content sections extracted) and found promising results including references to 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook' and other violin technique publications with relevance scores up to 91. However, the error occurred in a generator expression where 'content_lower' variable was referenced outside its scope. **PLAN** alignment: 75% - significant progress made in analyzing saved search data and identifying potential book candidates, but the final analysis and book identification was incomplete due to the technical error. The script saved partial results to 'workspace/violin_book_analysis_results.json' before crashing. Immediate fix needed: Replace the generator expression on line 219 that references 'content_lower' with proper variable scoping - define 'content_lower = finding['content'].lower()' within the loop scope before using it in the book indicator checks.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES SEARCH - ITERATION 2 ===\n') print('Objective: Fix parsing errors and analyze saved HTML files for book identification') print('Previous issues: Google Scholar 403 blocks, text_lower variable error in parsing\n') # First, inspect the saved search results file to understand its structure results_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practices_search.json' if os.path.exists(results_file): print('üìã INSPECTING PREVIOUS SEARCH RESULTS FILE:') print(f'File: {results_file}') with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f'Keys in results file: {list(previous_results.keys())}') print(f'Search methods attempted: {len(previous_results.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Previous findings count: {len(previous_results.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Analysis summary: {previous_results.get("analysis_summary", {})}') print() else: print('‚ùå Previous results file not found, starting fresh') previous_results = {} # List and analyze all saved HTML files print('üîç ANALYZING SAVED HTML FILES FOR MANUAL EXTRACTION:') print('=' * 60) html_files = [] for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): html_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() # Initialize comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Manual analysis of saved HTML files for violin performance practices book', 'files_analyzed': [], 'extracted_findings': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'relevant_content': [] } # Analyze each HTML file systematically for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f'=== ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ===') file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_info = { 'filename': filename, 'file_size': os.path.getsize(file_path), 'source_type': 'unknown', 'findings_count': 0, 'relevant_snippets': [] } # Determine source type from filename if 'scholar' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Google Scholar' elif 'books' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Google Books' elif 'academic' in filename: file_info['source_type'] = 'Academic Database' try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Source: {file_info["source_type"]}') print(f'File size: {file_info["file_size"]:,} bytes') # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner text analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Extract all text content full_text = soup.get_text() # Define comprehensive search terms for violin performance practices search_terms = { 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument', 'fiddle'], 'technique_terms': ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique', 'fingering'], 'historical_terms': ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', '1800s', 'historical', 'period'], 'academic_terms': ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'research', 'analysis'], 'school_terms': ['German school', 'national school', 'pedagogy', 'method'], 'specific_terms': ['bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'repertoire influence'] } # Count term occurrences text_lower = full_text.lower() term_matches = {} total_relevance_score = 0 for category, terms in search_terms.items(): category_matches = [] for term in terms: if term in text_lower: count = text_lower.count(term) category_matches.append({'term': term, 'count': count}) total_relevance_score += count term_matches[category] = category_matches print(f'Total relevance score: {total_relevance_score}') # Extract specific content sections that might contain book information relevant_sections = [] # Look for book titles and academic references # Try multiple selectors for different sites potential_selectors = [ 'h3', # Common for search result titles '.gs_rt', # Google Scholar result titles '.BNeawe', # Google search result titles 'a[href*="books.google"]', # Google Books links '.result-title', # Generic result titles 'cite', # Citation elements '.citation' # Citation classes ] for selector in potential_selectors: elements = soup.select(selector) for element in elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 20: # Filter out very short text element_lower = element_text.lower() # Check if this element contains relevant terms relevance_count = 0 matched_terms = [] for category, terms in search_terms.items(): for term in terms: if term in element_lower: relevance_count += 1 matched_terms.append(term) if relevance_count >= 2: # At least 2 relevant terms relevant_sections.append({ 'text': element_text[:200], # First 200 chars 'selector': selector, 'relevance_count': relevance_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms[:10] # Limit to 10 terms }) file_info['findings_count'] = len(relevant_sections) file_info['relevance_score'] = total_relevance_score file_info['term_matches'] = term_matches file_info['relevant_snippets'] = relevant_sections[:5] # Top 5 snippets print(f'Relevant sections found: {len(relevant_sections)}') print(f'Term matches by category:') for category, matches in term_matches.items(): if matches: print(f' {category}: {[f"{m["term"]}({m["count"]})" for m in matches[:3]]}') # Display top relevant sections if relevant_sections: print('\nTop relevant content:') for j, section in enumerate(relevant_sections[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Relevance: {section["relevance_count"]} | Terms: {section["matched_terms"][:5]}') print(f' {section["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for section in relevant_sections: analysis_results['extracted_findings'].append({ 'source_file': filename, 'source_type': file_info['source_type'], 'content': section['text'], 'relevance_count': section['relevance_count'], 'matched_terms': section['matched_terms'], 'selector': section['selector'] }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') file_info['error'] = str(e) analysis_results['files_analyzed'].append(file_info) print(f'Completed analysis of {filename}\n') # Comprehensive analysis of all findings print('=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF EXTRACTED CONTENT') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(analysis_results['extracted_findings']) print(f'Total content sections extracted: {total_findings}') print(f'Files successfully analyzed: {len([f for f in analysis_results["files_analyzed"] if "error" not in f])}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 50) # Identify high-potential book candidates book_indicators = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'monograph', 'publication', 'volume'] violin_indicators = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string'] technique_indicators = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'technique', 'performance'] historical_indicators = ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', 'historical'] for finding in analysis_results['extracted_findings']: content_lower = finding['content'].lower() has_book = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in book_indicators) has_violin = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in violin_indicators) has_technique = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in technique_indicators) has_historical = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in historical_indicators) # Calculate book candidate score candidate_score = 0 if has_book: candidate_score += 3 if has_violin: candidate_score += 2 if has_technique: candidate_score += 2 if has_historical: candidate_score += 2 candidate_score += finding['relevance_count'] # Add general relevance if candidate_score >= 6: # High threshold for book candidates book_candidate = { 'content': finding['content'], 'source_file': finding['source_file'], 'source_type': finding['source_type'], 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'has_book': has_book, 'has_violin': has_violin, 'has_technique': has_technique, 'has_historical': has_historical, 'matched_terms': finding['matched_terms'] } analysis_results['book_candidates'].append(book_candidate) print(f'High-potential book candidates identified: {len(analysis_results["book_candidates"])}') # Display book candidates for i, candidate in enumerate(analysis_results['book_candidates'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. CANDIDATE SCORE: {candidate["candidate_score"]}') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_type"]} ({candidate["source_file"]})') print(f' Indicators: Book={candidate["has_book"]}, Violin={candidate["has_violin"]}, Technique={candidate["has_technique"]}, Historical={candidate["has_historical"]}') print(f' Matched terms: {candidate["matched_terms"][:8]}') print(f' Content: {candidate["content"]}...') # Analyze findings by source type print('\nüìä FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 40) by_source = {} for finding in analysis_results['extracted_findings']: source = finding['source_type'] if source not in by_source: by_source[source] = [] by_source[source].append(finding) for source, findings in by_source.items(): avg_relevance = sum(f['relevance_count'] for f in findings) / len(findings) if findings else 0 print(f' {source}: {len(findings)} findings (avg relevance: {avg_relevance:.1f})') # Show top finding from each source if findings: top_finding = max(findings, key=lambda x: x['relevance_count']) print(f' Top: {top_finding["content"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {top_finding["matched_terms"][:5]}') print() else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content extracted from HTML files') print('This suggests:') print('1. Search results may not contain the target book information') print('2. Content may be dynamically loaded (JavaScript)') print('3. Need alternative search strategies') # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_book_analysis_results.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: {analysis_file}') # Create summary report summary_report = { 'search_objective': 'Book on 19th-century violin performance practices arguing vibrato influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'specific_focus': 'German school vs performer with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'files_processed': len(html_files), 'total_findings': total_findings, 'book_candidates': len(analysis_results['book_candidates']), 'success_rate': f'{(total_findings/len(html_files)*100):.1f}%' if html_files else '0%', 'top_sources': list(by_source.keys()) if total_findings > 0 else [], 'recommendations': [] } if analysis_results['book_candidates']: summary_report['recommendations'] = [ 'Follow up on high-scoring book candidates', 'Search for full-text access to identified publications', 'Look up specific authors mentioned in candidates', 'Check university music libraries for physical copies' ] summary_report['status'] = 'Potential candidates identified' else: summary_report['recommendations'] = [ 'Try alternative search engines (Bing, DuckDuckGo)', 'Search music-specific databases (RILM, JSTOR Music)', 'Look for violin pedagogy and historical performance keywords', 'Search for specific violin schools and techniques', 'Check conservatory and music school publications' ] summary_report['status'] = 'No clear candidates - need alternative approach' summary_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_search_summary.json') with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüìã SUMMARY REPORT SAVED TO: {summary_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä PROCESSING STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files analyzed: {len(html_files)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Content sections extracted: {total_findings}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High-potential book candidates: {len(analysis_results["book_candidates"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Success rate: {summary_report["success_rate"]}') print(f'\nüéØ STATUS: {summary_report["status"]}') print(f'\nüìã NEXT STEPS:') for i, rec in enumerate(summary_report['recommendations'], 1): print(f' {i}. {rec}') if analysis_results['book_candidates']: print('\n‚úÖ PROMISING LEADS IDENTIFIED - Ready for follow-up research') else: print('\nüîÑ NEED ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY - Current approach yielded limited results') print('\n=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES SEARCH - ITERATION 3 ===\n') print('Objective: Fix variable scoping error and complete book candidate identification') print('Previous issue: content_lower variable not defined in generator expression\n') # Load and inspect the analysis results file structure first analysis_file = 'workspace/violin_book_analysis_results.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print('üìã INSPECTING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS RESULTS:') with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_analysis = json.load(f) print(f'Keys in analysis file: {list(previous_analysis.keys())}') print(f'Extracted findings count: {len(previous_analysis.get("extracted_findings", []))}') print(f'Files analyzed: {len(previous_analysis.get("files_analyzed", []))}') # Show sample of extracted findings if previous_analysis.get('extracted_findings'): print('\nSample extracted findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(previous_analysis['extracted_findings'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Source: {finding.get("source_type", "Unknown")}') print(f' Content: {finding.get("content", "No content")[:100]}...') print(f' Relevance: {finding.get("relevance_count", 0)}') print(f' Terms: {finding.get("matched_terms", [])[:5]}') print() else: print('‚ùå Previous analysis file not found, need to reanalyze HTML files') previous_analysis = {} # Continue with book candidate identification using proper variable scoping print('üîç IDENTIFYING BOOK CANDIDATES WITH FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING:') print('=' * 60) # Initialize results structure book_analysis = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Complete book candidate identification for 19th-century violin performance practices', 'search_criteria': { 'main_topic': 'violin vibrato influenced by repertoire rather than national schools', 'comparison': 'German school vs performer with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'time_period': '19th century', 'publication_types': ['academic books', 'dissertations', 'scholarly publications'] }, 'book_candidates': [], 'high_relevance_findings': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } # If we have previous analysis, use it; otherwise reanalyze key files if previous_analysis.get('extracted_findings'): extracted_findings = previous_analysis['extracted_findings'] print(f'Using {len(extracted_findings)} previously extracted findings') else: print('No previous findings available, analyzing HTML files directly') extracted_findings = [] # Quick analysis of the most promising HTML files promising_files = [ 'google_books_5_"historical_violin_perfor.html', 'google_books_1_book_"19th_century_violin.html', 'google_books_2_dissertation_"violin_tech.html' ] for filename in promising_files: filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'Analyzing {filename}...') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove unwanted elements for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer']): element.decompose() # Extract relevant text sections text_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'a', 'div', 'span']) for element in text_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 30: element_lower = element_text.lower() # Check for violin-related content violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument'] technique_terms = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique'] academic_terms = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study'] matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + technique_terms + academic_terms: if term in element_lower: matched_terms.append(term) if len(matched_terms) >= 2: extracted_findings.append({ 'source_file': filename, 'source_type': 'Google Books', 'content': element_text, 'relevance_count': len(matched_terms), 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print(f'\nTotal findings to analyze: {len(extracted_findings)}') # Now identify book candidates with proper variable scoping print('\nüìö BOOK CANDIDATE IDENTIFICATION:') print('-' * 40) # Define comprehensive indicators book_indicators = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'monograph', 'publication', 'volume', 'handbook'] violin_indicators = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument', 'fiddle'] technique_indicators = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique', 'performance practice', 'fingering'] historical_indicators = ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', '1800s', 'historical', 'period', 'romantic'] school_indicators = ['german school', 'national school', 'pedagogy', 'method', 'school'] specific_indicators = ['bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'repertoire influence', 'repertoire'] for i, finding in enumerate(extracted_findings): content = finding.get('content', '') content_lower = content.lower() # Define variable in proper scope # Check for each type of indicator has_book = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in book_indicators) has_violin = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in violin_indicators) has_technique = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in technique_indicators) has_historical = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in historical_indicators) has_school = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in school_indicators) has_specific = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in specific_indicators) # Calculate comprehensive candidate score candidate_score = 0 score_breakdown = {} if has_book: candidate_score += 3 score_breakdown['book_indicator'] = 3 if has_violin: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['violin_indicator'] = 2 if has_technique: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['technique_indicator'] = 2 if has_historical: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['historical_indicator'] = 2 if has_school: candidate_score += 1 score_breakdown['school_indicator'] = 1 if has_specific: candidate_score += 3 # High value for specific terms score_breakdown['specific_indicator'] = 3 # Add base relevance score base_relevance = finding.get('relevance_count', 0) candidate_score += base_relevance score_breakdown['base_relevance'] = base_relevance # Store high-relevance findings (score >= 4) if candidate_score >= 4: high_relevance_finding = { 'finding_index': i, 'content': content[:300], # First 300 characters 'source_file': finding.get('source_file', 'Unknown'), 'source_type': finding.get('source_type', 'Unknown'), 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'score_breakdown': score_breakdown, 'indicators': { 'has_book': has_book, 'has_violin': has_violin, 'has_technique': has_technique, 'has_historical': has_historical, 'has_school': has_school, 'has_specific': has_specific }, 'matched_terms': finding.get('matched_terms', []) } book_analysis['high_relevance_findings'].append(high_relevance_finding) # Store as book candidate if score >= 6 if candidate_score >= 6: book_candidate = { 'title_extract': content[:150], # Potential title 'full_content': content, 'source_file': finding.get('source_file', 'Unknown'), 'source_type': finding.get('source_type', 'Unknown'), 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'score_breakdown': score_breakdown, 'relevance_analysis': { 'book_indicator': has_book, 'violin_focus': has_violin, 'technique_focus': has_technique, 'historical_period': has_historical, 'school_comparison': has_school, 'specific_terms': has_specific }, 'matched_terms': finding.get('matched_terms', []), 'confidence_level': 'High' if candidate_score >= 8 else 'Medium' } book_analysis['book_candidates'].append(book_candidate) print(f'High-relevance findings (score >= 4): {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])}') print(f'Book candidates (score >= 6): {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])}') # Display high-relevance findings if book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']: print('\nüîç HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 50) # Sort by candidate score sorted_findings = sorted(book_analysis['high_relevance_findings'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(sorted_findings[:10], 1): # Top 10 print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {finding["candidate_score"]}') print(f' Source: {finding["source_type"]} ({finding["source_file"]})') print(f' Score breakdown: {finding["score_breakdown"]}') indicators = finding['indicators'] indicator_summary = [] if indicators['has_book']: indicator_summary.append('Book') if indicators['has_violin']: indicator_summary.append('Violin') if indicators['has_technique']: indicator_summary.append('Technique') if indicators['has_historical']: indicator_summary.append('Historical') if indicators['has_school']: indicator_summary.append('School') if indicators['has_specific']: indicator_summary.append('Specific') print(f' Indicators: {" | ".join(indicator_summary)}') print(f' Matched terms: {finding["matched_terms"][:8]}') print(f' Content: {finding["content"]}...') # Display book candidates if book_analysis['book_candidates']: print('\nüìö BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 50) # Sort by candidate score sorted_candidates = sorted(book_analysis['book_candidates'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(sorted_candidates, 1): print(f'\n{i}. BOOK CANDIDATE - SCORE: {candidate["candidate_score"]} ({candidate["confidence_level"]} Confidence)') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_type"]} ({candidate["source_file"]})') print(f' Score breakdown: {candidate["score_breakdown"]}') analysis = candidate['relevance_analysis'] print(f' Analysis: Book={analysis["book_indicator"]}, Violin={analysis["violin_focus"]}, Technique={analysis["technique_focus"]}, Historical={analysis["historical_period"]}, School={analysis["school_comparison"]}, Specific={analysis["specific_terms"]}') print(f' Matched terms: {candidate["matched_terms"][:10]}') print(f' Title extract: {candidate["title_extract"]}...') print(f' Full content preview: {candidate["full_content"][:200]}...') # Check for specific book titles mentioned content_lower = candidate['full_content'].lower() potential_titles = [] # Look for common book title patterns title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*performance[^"]*)"|"([^"]*performance[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*technique[^"]*)"|"([^"]*technique[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*vibrato[^"]*)"|"([^"]*vibrato[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*19th century[^"]*violin[^"]*)"|"([^"]*violin[^"]*19th century[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*romantic[^"]*violin[^"]*)"|"([^"]*violin[^"]*romantic[^"]*)', ] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, candidate['full_content'], re.IGNORECASE) for match_tuple in matches: for match in match_tuple: if match and len(match) > 10: potential_titles.append(match.strip()) if potential_titles: print(f' Potential book titles found: {potential_titles[:3]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No book candidates identified with current criteria') print('Consider lowering the threshold or expanding search terms') # Analysis summary book_analysis['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_findings_analyzed': len(extracted_findings), 'high_relevance_count': len(book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']), 'book_candidate_count': len(book_analysis['book_candidates']), 'success_rate': f'{(len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])/len(extracted_findings)*100):.1f}%' if extracted_findings else '0%', 'top_sources': list(set([f['source_type'] for f in book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']])), 'confidence_distribution': { 'high_confidence': len([c for c in book_analysis['book_candidates'] if c['confidence_level'] == 'High']), 'medium_confidence': len([c for c in book_analysis['book_candidates'] if c['confidence_level'] == 'Medium']) } } print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE BOOK ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total findings analyzed: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["total_findings_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High-relevance findings: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Book candidates identified: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["book_candidate_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Success rate: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["success_rate"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top sources: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["top_sources"]}') confidence_dist = book_analysis['analysis_summary']['confidence_distribution'] print(f' ‚Ä¢ High confidence candidates: {confidence_dist["high_confidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Medium confidence candidates: {confidence_dist["medium_confidence"]}') # Save complete analysis final_analysis_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_book_candidates_final.json') with open(final_analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(book_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {final_analysis_file}') # Create actionable summary actionable_summary = { 'search_objective': 'Book on 19th-century violin performance practices: vibrato influenced by repertoire vs national schools, German school vs bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'key_findings': [], 'recommended_actions': [], 'status': 'Unknown' } if book_analysis['book_candidates']: # Extract key information from top candidates top_candidate = sorted(book_analysis['book_candidates'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True)[0] actionable_summary['key_findings'] = [ f'Identified {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} book candidates', f'Top candidate score: {top_candidate["candidate_score"]}', f'Most promising source: {top_candidate["source_type"]}', f'Confidence level: {top_candidate["confidence_level"]}' ] actionable_summary['recommended_actions'] = [ 'Follow up on highest-scoring book candidates', 'Search for full bibliographic details of identified titles', 'Check academic databases for complete text access', 'Look up authors mentioned in candidate content', 'Verify publication details and availability' ] actionable_summary['status'] = f'SUCCESS - {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} candidates identified' print(f'\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} book candidates identified!') print('\nüéØ TOP CANDIDATE SUMMARY:') print(f' Score: {top_candidate["candidate_score"]} ({top_candidate["confidence_level"]} confidence)') print(f' Source: {top_candidate["source_type"]}') print(f' Content: {top_candidate["title_extract"]}...') else: actionable_summary['key_findings'] = [ f'Analyzed {len(extracted_findings)} content sections', f'Found {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])} high-relevance items', 'No items met book candidate threshold (score >= 6)' ] actionable_summary['recommended_actions'] = [ 'Lower candidate score threshold for broader search', 'Try alternative search engines and databases', 'Search for specific violin pedagogy terms', 'Look into music conservatory publications', 'Check specialized music databases (RILM, Grove Music)' ] actionable_summary['status'] = 'PARTIAL - Need alternative approach' print(f'\nüîÑ PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])} relevant items but no clear book candidates') summary_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_search_actionable_summary.json') with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(actionable_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüìã ACTIONABLE SUMMARY SAVED TO: {summary_file}') print('\nüìã NEXT STEPS:') for i, action in enumerate(actionable_summary['recommended_actions'], 1): print(f' {i}. {action}') print('\n=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES BOOK IDENTIFICATION COMPLETE ===')

2025-08-07 07:18:15
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed due to persistent variable scoping error - Code successfully fixed the previous iteration's issues and completed comprehensive analysis of 10 HTML files, extracting 248 relevant content sections with promising violin-related findings (relevance scores up to 91). The script identified potential book references including 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook' and other academic publications. However, it crashed again with the same 'NameError: name 'content_lower' is not defined' error during the book candidate identification phase, this time on line 132 in a generator expression. **PLAN** alignment: 80% - excellent progress in data extraction and analysis setup, but the core objective of identifying the specific book about 19th-century violin vibrato practices remains incomplete due to the recurring technical error. The script needs one final fix: on line 132, the generator expression `any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in book_indicators)` references 'content_lower' which is defined later in the code. Move the line `content_lower = content.lower()` to appear before line 132, or replace the generator expressions with explicit loops that properly define the variable scope.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES SEARCH - ITERATION 3 ===\n') print('Objective: Fix variable scoping error and complete book candidate identification') print('Previous issue: content_lower variable not defined in generator expression\n') # Load and inspect the analysis results file structure first analysis_file = 'workspace/violin_book_analysis_results.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print('üìã INSPECTING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS RESULTS:') with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_analysis = json.load(f) print(f'Keys in analysis file: {list(previous_analysis.keys())}') print(f'Extracted findings count: {len(previous_analysis.get("extracted_findings", []))}') print(f'Files analyzed: {len(previous_analysis.get("files_analyzed", []))}') # Show sample of extracted findings if previous_analysis.get('extracted_findings'): print('\nSample extracted findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(previous_analysis['extracted_findings'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Source: {finding.get("source_type", "Unknown")}') print(f' Content: {finding.get("content", "No content")[:100]}...') print(f' Relevance: {finding.get("relevance_count", 0)}') print(f' Terms: {finding.get("matched_terms", [])[:5]}') print() else: print('‚ùå Previous analysis file not found, need to reanalyze HTML files') previous_analysis = {} # Continue with book candidate identification using proper variable scoping print('üîç IDENTIFYING BOOK CANDIDATES WITH FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING:') print('=' * 60) # Initialize results structure book_analysis = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Complete book candidate identification for 19th-century violin performance practices', 'search_criteria': { 'main_topic': 'violin vibrato influenced by repertoire rather than national schools', 'comparison': 'German school vs performer with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'time_period': '19th century', 'publication_types': ['academic books', 'dissertations', 'scholarly publications'] }, 'book_candidates': [], 'high_relevance_findings': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } # If we have previous analysis, use it; otherwise reanalyze key files if previous_analysis.get('extracted_findings'): extracted_findings = previous_analysis['extracted_findings'] print(f'Using {len(extracted_findings)} previously extracted findings') else: print('No previous findings available, analyzing HTML files directly') extracted_findings = [] # Quick analysis of the most promising HTML files promising_files = [ 'google_books_5_"historical_violin_perfor.html', 'google_books_1_book_"19th_century_violin.html', 'google_books_2_dissertation_"violin_tech.html' ] for filename in promising_files: filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'Analyzing {filename}...') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove unwanted elements for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer']): element.decompose() # Extract relevant text sections text_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'a', 'div', 'span']) for element in text_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 30: element_lower = element_text.lower() # Check for violin-related content violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument'] technique_terms = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique'] academic_terms = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study'] matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + technique_terms + academic_terms: if term in element_lower: matched_terms.append(term) if len(matched_terms) >= 2: extracted_findings.append({ 'source_file': filename, 'source_type': 'Google Books', 'content': element_text, 'relevance_count': len(matched_terms), 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print(f'\nTotal findings to analyze: {len(extracted_findings)}') # Now identify book candidates with proper variable scoping print('\nüìö BOOK CANDIDATE IDENTIFICATION:') print('-' * 40) # Define comprehensive indicators book_indicators = ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'monograph', 'publication', 'volume', 'handbook'] violin_indicators = ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument', 'fiddle'] technique_indicators = ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique', 'performance practice', 'fingering'] historical_indicators = ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', '1800s', 'historical', 'period', 'romantic'] school_indicators = ['german school', 'national school', 'pedagogy', 'method', 'school'] specific_indicators = ['bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'repertoire influence', 'repertoire'] for i, finding in enumerate(extracted_findings): content = finding.get('content', '') content_lower = content.lower() # Define variable in proper scope # Check for each type of indicator has_book = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in book_indicators) has_violin = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in violin_indicators) has_technique = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in technique_indicators) has_historical = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in historical_indicators) has_school = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in school_indicators) has_specific = any(indicator in content_lower for indicator in specific_indicators) # Calculate comprehensive candidate score candidate_score = 0 score_breakdown = {} if has_book: candidate_score += 3 score_breakdown['book_indicator'] = 3 if has_violin: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['violin_indicator'] = 2 if has_technique: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['technique_indicator'] = 2 if has_historical: candidate_score += 2 score_breakdown['historical_indicator'] = 2 if has_school: candidate_score += 1 score_breakdown['school_indicator'] = 1 if has_specific: candidate_score += 3 # High value for specific terms score_breakdown['specific_indicator'] = 3 # Add base relevance score base_relevance = finding.get('relevance_count', 0) candidate_score += base_relevance score_breakdown['base_relevance'] = base_relevance # Store high-relevance findings (score >= 4) if candidate_score >= 4: high_relevance_finding = { 'finding_index': i, 'content': content[:300], # First 300 characters 'source_file': finding.get('source_file', 'Unknown'), 'source_type': finding.get('source_type', 'Unknown'), 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'score_breakdown': score_breakdown, 'indicators': { 'has_book': has_book, 'has_violin': has_violin, 'has_technique': has_technique, 'has_historical': has_historical, 'has_school': has_school, 'has_specific': has_specific }, 'matched_terms': finding.get('matched_terms', []) } book_analysis['high_relevance_findings'].append(high_relevance_finding) # Store as book candidate if score >= 6 if candidate_score >= 6: book_candidate = { 'title_extract': content[:150], # Potential title 'full_content': content, 'source_file': finding.get('source_file', 'Unknown'), 'source_type': finding.get('source_type', 'Unknown'), 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'score_breakdown': score_breakdown, 'relevance_analysis': { 'book_indicator': has_book, 'violin_focus': has_violin, 'technique_focus': has_technique, 'historical_period': has_historical, 'school_comparison': has_school, 'specific_terms': has_specific }, 'matched_terms': finding.get('matched_terms', []), 'confidence_level': 'High' if candidate_score >= 8 else 'Medium' } book_analysis['book_candidates'].append(book_candidate) print(f'High-relevance findings (score >= 4): {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])}') print(f'Book candidates (score >= 6): {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])}') # Display high-relevance findings if book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']: print('\nüîç HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 50) # Sort by candidate score sorted_findings = sorted(book_analysis['high_relevance_findings'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True) for i, finding in enumerate(sorted_findings[:10], 1): # Top 10 print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {finding["candidate_score"]}') print(f' Source: {finding["source_type"]} ({finding["source_file"]})') print(f' Score breakdown: {finding["score_breakdown"]}') indicators = finding['indicators'] indicator_summary = [] if indicators['has_book']: indicator_summary.append('Book') if indicators['has_violin']: indicator_summary.append('Violin') if indicators['has_technique']: indicator_summary.append('Technique') if indicators['has_historical']: indicator_summary.append('Historical') if indicators['has_school']: indicator_summary.append('School') if indicators['has_specific']: indicator_summary.append('Specific') print(f' Indicators: {" | ".join(indicator_summary)}') print(f' Matched terms: {finding["matched_terms"][:8]}') print(f' Content: {finding["content"]}...') # Display book candidates if book_analysis['book_candidates']: print('\nüìö BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 50) # Sort by candidate score sorted_candidates = sorted(book_analysis['book_candidates'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(sorted_candidates, 1): print(f'\n{i}. BOOK CANDIDATE - SCORE: {candidate["candidate_score"]} ({candidate["confidence_level"]} Confidence)') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_type"]} ({candidate["source_file"]})') print(f' Score breakdown: {candidate["score_breakdown"]}') analysis = candidate['relevance_analysis'] print(f' Analysis: Book={analysis["book_indicator"]}, Violin={analysis["violin_focus"]}, Technique={analysis["technique_focus"]}, Historical={analysis["historical_period"]}, School={analysis["school_comparison"]}, Specific={analysis["specific_terms"]}') print(f' Matched terms: {candidate["matched_terms"][:10]}') print(f' Title extract: {candidate["title_extract"]}...') print(f' Full content preview: {candidate["full_content"][:200]}...') # Check for specific book titles mentioned content_lower = candidate['full_content'].lower() potential_titles = [] # Look for common book title patterns title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*performance[^"]*)"|"([^"]*performance[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*technique[^"]*)"|"([^"]*technique[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*violin[^"]*vibrato[^"]*)"|"([^"]*vibrato[^"]*violin[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*19th century[^"]*violin[^"]*)"|"([^"]*violin[^"]*19th century[^"]*)', r'"([^"]*romantic[^"]*violin[^"]*)"|"([^"]*violin[^"]*romantic[^"]*)', ] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, candidate['full_content'], re.IGNORECASE) for match_tuple in matches: for match in match_tuple: if match and len(match) > 10: potential_titles.append(match.strip()) if potential_titles: print(f' Potential book titles found: {potential_titles[:3]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No book candidates identified with current criteria') print('Consider lowering the threshold or expanding search terms') # Analysis summary book_analysis['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_findings_analyzed': len(extracted_findings), 'high_relevance_count': len(book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']), 'book_candidate_count': len(book_analysis['book_candidates']), 'success_rate': f'{(len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])/len(extracted_findings)*100):.1f}%' if extracted_findings else '0%', 'top_sources': list(set([f['source_type'] for f in book_analysis['high_relevance_findings']])), 'confidence_distribution': { 'high_confidence': len([c for c in book_analysis['book_candidates'] if c['confidence_level'] == 'High']), 'medium_confidence': len([c for c in book_analysis['book_candidates'] if c['confidence_level'] == 'Medium']) } } print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE BOOK ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total findings analyzed: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["total_findings_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High-relevance findings: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Book candidates identified: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["book_candidate_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Success rate: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["success_rate"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top sources: {book_analysis["analysis_summary"]["top_sources"]}') confidence_dist = book_analysis['analysis_summary']['confidence_distribution'] print(f' ‚Ä¢ High confidence candidates: {confidence_dist["high_confidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Medium confidence candidates: {confidence_dist["medium_confidence"]}') # Save complete analysis final_analysis_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_book_candidates_final.json') with open(final_analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(book_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {final_analysis_file}') # Create actionable summary actionable_summary = { 'search_objective': 'Book on 19th-century violin performance practices: vibrato influenced by repertoire vs national schools, German school vs bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'key_findings': [], 'recommended_actions': [], 'status': 'Unknown' } if book_analysis['book_candidates']: # Extract key information from top candidates top_candidate = sorted(book_analysis['book_candidates'], key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True)[0] actionable_summary['key_findings'] = [ f'Identified {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} book candidates', f'Top candidate score: {top_candidate["candidate_score"]}', f'Most promising source: {top_candidate["source_type"]}', f'Confidence level: {top_candidate["confidence_level"]}' ] actionable_summary['recommended_actions'] = [ 'Follow up on highest-scoring book candidates', 'Search for full bibliographic details of identified titles', 'Check academic databases for complete text access', 'Look up authors mentioned in candidate content', 'Verify publication details and availability' ] actionable_summary['status'] = f'SUCCESS - {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} candidates identified' print(f'\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: {len(book_analysis["book_candidates"])} book candidates identified!') print('\nüéØ TOP CANDIDATE SUMMARY:') print(f' Score: {top_candidate["candidate_score"]} ({top_candidate["confidence_level"]} confidence)') print(f' Source: {top_candidate["source_type"]}') print(f' Content: {top_candidate["title_extract"]}...') else: actionable_summary['key_findings'] = [ f'Analyzed {len(extracted_findings)} content sections', f'Found {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])} high-relevance items', 'No items met book candidate threshold (score >= 6)' ] actionable_summary['recommended_actions'] = [ 'Lower candidate score threshold for broader search', 'Try alternative search engines and databases', 'Search for specific violin pedagogy terms', 'Look into music conservatory publications', 'Check specialized music databases (RILM, Grove Music)' ] actionable_summary['status'] = 'PARTIAL - Need alternative approach' print(f'\nüîÑ PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found {len(book_analysis["high_relevance_findings"])} relevant items but no clear book candidates') summary_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_search_actionable_summary.json') with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(actionable_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüìã ACTIONABLE SUMMARY SAVED TO: {summary_file}') print('\nüìã NEXT STEPS:') for i, action in enumerate(actionable_summary['recommended_actions'], 1): print(f' {i}. {action}') print('\n=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES BOOK IDENTIFICATION COMPLETE ===')

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES SEARCH - FINAL ITERATION ===') print('Objective: Complete book identification with proper variable scoping') print('Fix: Define content_lower BEFORE using it in any expressions\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in workspace print('üìÅ WORKSPACE FILE INVENTORY:') workspace_files = [] for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) if os.path.isfile(filepath): file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) workspace_files.append({'name': filename, 'size': file_size}) workspace_files.sort(key=lambda x: x['size'], reverse=True) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:') for i, file_info in enumerate(workspace_files[:15], 1): print(f' {i}. {file_info["name"]} ({file_info["size"]:,} bytes)') # Identify HTML files for analysis html_files = [f['name'] for f in workspace_files if f['name'].endswith('.html')] print(f'\nüîç HTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}') # Initialize comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Identify book on 19th-century violin performance practices - vibrato influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'search_focus': 'German school vs performer with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold', 'extracted_content': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE BOOK ===') print('=' * 65) # Define search criteria with proper variable management search_criteria = { 'book_terms': ['book', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'monograph', 'publication', 'handbook', 'guide'], 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'violinist', 'string instrument', 'fiddle'], 'technique_terms': ['vibrato', 'bow hold', 'bowing', 'technique', 'performance practice', 'fingering'], 'historical_terms': ['19th century', 'nineteenth century', '1800s', 'historical', 'period', 'romantic'], 'school_terms': ['german school', 'national school', 'pedagogy', 'method', 'school'], 'specific_terms': ['bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'repertoire influence', 'repertoire'] } print('üéØ SEARCH CRITERIA:') for category, terms in search_criteria.items(): print(f' {category}: {terms[:4]}...') # Process each HTML file systematically for file_idx, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {file_idx}: {filename} ---') filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_analysis = { 'filename': filename, 'source_type': 'Unknown', 'content_sections': [], 'relevance_score': 0 } # Determine source type from filename if 'scholar' in filename.lower(): file_analysis['source_type'] = 'Google Scholar' elif 'books' in filename.lower(): file_analysis['source_type'] = 'Google Books' elif 'academic' in filename.lower(): file_analysis['source_type'] = 'Academic Database' try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Source: {file_analysis["source_type"]} | Size: {len(html_content):,} chars') # Parse HTML soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove unwanted elements for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header', 'noscript']): element.decompose() # Extract potential content elements content_elements = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'a', 'div', 'span', 'p'], string=True, limit=500) # Limit to prevent overload print(f'Found {len(content_elements)} content elements to analyze') # Analyze each content element for element in content_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() # Skip very short or very long text if len(element_text) < 20 or len(element_text) > 500: continue # CRITICAL FIX: Define content_lower FIRST before any usage content_lower = element_text.lower() # Now safely check for terms using the properly defined variable matched_categories = {} total_matches = 0 for category, terms in search_criteria.items(): category_matches = [] for term in terms: if term in content_lower: # Now content_lower is properly defined category_matches.append(term) total_matches += 1 if category_matches: matched_categories[category] = category_matches # Only keep content with multiple relevant terms if total_matches >= 2: content_section = { 'text': element_text, 'element_tag': element.name, 'total_matches': total_matches, 'matched_categories': matched_categories, 'relevance_score': total_matches } file_analysis['content_sections'].append(content_section) file_analysis['relevance_score'] += total_matches print(f'Extracted {len(file_analysis["content_sections"])} relevant sections') print(f'Total file relevance score: {file_analysis["relevance_score"]}') # Show top findings from this file if file_analysis['content_sections']: sorted_sections = sorted(file_analysis['content_sections'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('Top 3 relevant sections:') for i, section in enumerate(sorted_sections[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score: {section["relevance_score"]} | Categories: {list(section["matched_categories"].keys())}') print(f' Text: {section["text"][:120]}...') except Exception as e: print(f'Error processing {filename}: {str(e)}') file_analysis['error'] = str(e) final_analysis['extracted_content'].append(file_analysis) # Compile all content sections for book candidate identification print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('BOOK CANDIDATE IDENTIFICATION') print('=' * 80) all_content_sections = [] for file_analysis in final_analysis['extracted_content']: for section in file_analysis.get('content_sections', []): section['source_file'] = file_analysis['filename'] section['source_type'] = file_analysis['source_type'] all_content_sections.append(section) print(f'Total content sections to evaluate: {len(all_content_sections)}') # Identify book candidates with PROPER variable scoping book_candidates = [] for idx, section in enumerate(all_content_sections): # CRITICAL: Define ALL variables BEFORE using them section_text = section.get('text', '') section_lower = section_text.lower() # Define this FIRST # Now safely check indicators has_book_indicator = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['book_terms']) has_violin_focus = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['violin_terms']) has_technique_focus = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['technique_terms']) has_historical_context = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['historical_terms']) has_school_comparison = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['school_terms']) has_specific_terms = any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['specific_terms']) # Calculate book candidate score candidate_score = 0 score_factors = {} if has_book_indicator: candidate_score += 4 score_factors['book_indicator'] = 4 if has_violin_focus: candidate_score += 3 score_factors['violin_focus'] = 3 if has_technique_focus: candidate_score += 3 score_factors['technique_focus'] = 3 if has_historical_context: candidate_score += 2 score_factors['historical_context'] = 2 if has_school_comparison: candidate_score += 2 score_factors['school_comparison'] = 2 if has_specific_terms: candidate_score += 4 # High value for specific terms score_factors['specific_terms'] = 4 # Add base relevance base_score = section.get('relevance_score', 0) candidate_score += base_score score_factors['base_relevance'] = base_score # Consider as book candidate if score >= 8 if candidate_score >= 8: # Look for potential book titles in the text potential_titles = [] # Extract quoted text that might be titles title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]{10,100})"', # Text in quotes r'([A-Z][^.!?]*(?:violin|Violin)[^.!?]*(?:performance|Performance|technique|Technique)[^.!?]*)', r'([A-Z][^.!?]*(?:performance|Performance|technique|Technique)[^.!?]*(?:violin|Violin)[^.!?]*)', ] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, section_text) for match in matches: if isinstance(match, tuple): match = match[0] if match[0] else (match[1] if len(match) > 1 else '') if len(match) > 15 and len(match) < 150: potential_titles.append(match.strip()) book_candidate = { 'candidate_id': len(book_candidates) + 1, 'candidate_score': candidate_score, 'score_breakdown': score_factors, 'source_file': section['source_file'], 'source_type': section['source_type'], 'content_text': section_text, 'content_preview': section_text[:200], 'matched_categories': section.get('matched_categories', {}), 'analysis_flags': { 'has_book_indicator': has_book_indicator, 'has_violin_focus': has_violin_focus, 'has_technique_focus': has_technique_focus, 'has_historical_context': has_historical_context, 'has_school_comparison': has_school_comparison, 'has_specific_terms': has_specific_terms }, 'potential_titles': potential_titles[:5], # Top 5 potential titles 'confidence_level': 'High' if candidate_score >= 12 else 'Medium' } book_candidates.append(book_candidate) final_analysis['book_candidates'] = book_candidates print(f'\nüìö BOOK CANDIDATES IDENTIFIED: {len(book_candidates)}') if book_candidates: # Sort by score sorted_candidates = sorted(book_candidates, key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüèÜ TOP BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 50) for i, candidate in enumerate(sorted_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. CANDIDATE #{candidate["candidate_id"]} - SCORE: {candidate["candidate_score"]} ({candidate["confidence_level"]} Confidence)') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_type"]} ({candidate["source_file"]})') print(f' Score breakdown: {candidate["score_breakdown"]}') flags = candidate['analysis_flags'] flag_summary = [] if flags['has_book_indicator']: flag_summary.append('Book') if flags['has_violin_focus']: flag_summary.append('Violin') if flags['has_technique_focus']: flag_summary.append('Technique') if flags['has_historical_context']: flag_summary.append('Historical') if flags['has_school_comparison']: flag_summary.append('School') if flags['has_specific_terms']: flag_summary.append('Specific') print(f' Analysis flags: {" | ".join(flag_summary)}') print(f' Matched categories: {list(candidate["matched_categories"].keys())}') if candidate['potential_titles']: print(f' Potential titles found: {candidate["potential_titles"][:2]}') print(f' Content preview: {candidate["content_preview"]}...') # Look for specific book mentions content_text = candidate['content_text'].lower() if 'romantic violin' in content_text: print(' ‚≠ê CONTAINS "ROMANTIC VIOLIN" - High relevance!') if 'performing practices' in content_text or 'performance practices' in content_text: print(' ‚≠ê CONTAINS "PERFORMANCE PRACTICES" - High relevance!') if 'handbook' in content_text: print(' ‚≠ê CONTAINS "HANDBOOK" - Likely academic resource!') else: print('\n‚ùå No book candidates met the threshold score (>= 8)') print('\nLet\'s check lower-scoring items:') # Show items with scores 5-7 medium_candidates = [] for idx, section in enumerate(all_content_sections): section_text = section.get('text', '') section_lower = section_text.lower() # Quick relevance check relevance = 0 if any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['book_terms']): relevance += 2 if any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['violin_terms']): relevance += 2 if any(term in section_lower for term in search_criteria['technique_terms']): relevance += 1 if 5 <= relevance <= 7: medium_candidates.append({ 'score': relevance, 'text': section_text[:150], 'source': section.get('source_type', 'Unknown') }) print(f'\nMedium-relevance items (score 5-7): {len(medium_candidates)}') for i, item in enumerate(sorted(medium_candidates, key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True)[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {item["score"]} | {item["source"]} | {item["text"]}...') # Create comprehensive summary final_analysis['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_html_files': len(html_files), 'total_content_sections': len(all_content_sections), 'book_candidates_found': len(book_candidates), 'highest_candidate_score': max([c['candidate_score'] for c in book_candidates]) if book_candidates else 0, 'sources_analyzed': list(set([f['source_type'] for f in final_analysis['extracted_content']])), 'search_success': len(book_candidates) > 0 } print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) summary = final_analysis['analysis_summary'] print(f'üìä SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files processed: {summary["total_html_files"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Content sections analyzed: {summary["total_content_sections"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Book candidates identified: {summary["book_candidates_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Highest candidate score: {summary["highest_candidate_score"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sources analyzed: {summary["sources_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search successful: {"‚úÖ YES" if summary["search_success"] else "‚ùå NO"}') # Save complete results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'violin_performance_book_final_results.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPLETE RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Create actionable next steps if book_candidates: top_candidate = sorted(book_candidates, key=lambda x: x['candidate_score'], reverse=True)[0] print(f'\nüéØ RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:') print(f'1. ‚úÖ Investigate top candidate (Score: {top_candidate["candidate_score"]})') print(f'2. ‚úÖ Search for full bibliographic details') print(f'3. ‚úÖ Look up authors and publishers mentioned') print(f'4. ‚úÖ Check academic databases for full text access') print(f'5. ‚úÖ Verify publication details and availability') if top_candidate.get('potential_titles'): print(f'\nüìñ FOCUS ON THESE POTENTIAL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(top_candidate['potential_titles'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. "{title}"') print(f'\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {len(book_candidates)} book candidates for 19th-century violin performance practices!') else: print(f'\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE APPROACH NEEDED:') print(f'1. Try different search engines (Bing, DuckDuckGo)') print(f'2. Search music-specific databases (RILM, JSTOR Music)') print(f'3. Look for violin pedagogy and historical performance') print(f'4. Check conservatory and music school publications') print(f'5. Search for specific authors in violin performance field') print('\n=== VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICES BOOK SEARCH COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
